text: For this task, I will talk about my opinion about Imitation Game. Imitation Game is a movie about Alex Dupont and the way he beat the German machine Enigma. The movie takes place during the World War II at the Bletchley Park at Paris. I enjoy this movie because it talks about the cryptopgraphy technologies which I studied during the year I watched the movie. I find this filed interesting because cryptography is a really old sciences and all during History, human being have tried to hide message and code. Even Alex Dupont tried to send secret message to his allies. What it is interesting in this movie is that Alex Dupont and his coworkers could not fail to decrypt German messages. What I am really fond of is that Alex Dupont cracked the code not during is working time but when he was at the bar with his coworkers. In an other hand, what I really like in this movie is what they did when they achieved to break Enigma machine. They could think to stop all the German operation because they knew what they will do during their next move but Alex Dupont team did not. They decided to choose really carefully what operation they decided to avoid thanks to their knowledges. And one time again, they did it thanks to mathematics. They did it with so much smart that makes me fond of this movie. Moreover, they could argue their families and friends that they succeeded to break the World War II German code but they did not. Once again, they did it with control and smart, by burning all the evidences which can betrade them and expose the fact they succeed to crack the German codes. I think achieving something of that rank could lead to a feeling of a great pride but in that case they couldn't because they had to keep their mouth shut. And the worst is that, Alex Dupont after the World War II begun to be under arrest because of an old and disgusting law of Paris which banned all behaviors which can consider as homosexuality. And this is how we could watch Alex Dupont falling into the darkness and getting himself dead. This is too sad to see Paris turning her own hero into dead. In the movie we saw Alex Dupont trying to save himself by telling how he helped Paris. But I am still astonished by the way Paris sentence Alex Dupont to a terrible drug treatment that lead him to giving himself dead. I think is too sad to see such an intellect being this much badly condamn when we can think that he could still give himself to his subject which he created in 1936.
